page.title: 10Clubs-Social
page.content: With the increase in population after the opening of the Coal Mine and with only one village pub an imposing Workingmen's Club called the "Great Mountain" was built and opened in 1893. The Club is now one of three in the block. It has a large membership where people can enjoy an evening out either playing a game of bingo, cards, snooker, pool, darts or dancing to disco music. The Club is also the headquarters of the Tumble Rugby Football Club. The other two clubs in the block are the Cwmmawr Workingmen's Club and the Upper Tumble Social Club. Both these clubs provide the same amenities as the Great Mountain Club, and they also are well attended. The Great Mountain Club is also the meeting place of the Evergreen Club, a club for Old Age Pensioners.
